chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating A Motor Vehicle While Under The Influence-4TH Offense and Operating With Prohibited Alcohol Concentration-4TH Offense. The defendant was found guilty of Operating A Motor Vehicle While Under The Influence-4TH Offense and the other charge, Operating With Prohibited Alcohol Concentration-4TH Offense was dismissed by the court.

  • Carlos A Rodriguez was found guilty of Operating A Motor Vehicle While Under The Influence-4TH Offense, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with sentences in case 20CT1218 and 20CT1163.

superMiscConds.notes:
No further law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No driving without a valid drivers license.
No contact with firearms.

Cooperate with agent as to home and office visits.
Cooperate with agent as to any treatment programs deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA assessment and comply with treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: 2 year IID installed on all vehicles titled/registered to defendant.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor/ammunition/explosives.
The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank.
Court imposed a $600 fine.
The Court orderd that all court costs, fees, surcharges including the DNA and Drunk Driver's surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining  due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
_Court set restitution at $0.00

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos A Rodriguez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Carlos A Rodriguez in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Carlos A Rodriguez in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, CONCURRENT with sentences in Case 20 ct 1218 and 20 ct 1163, with credit for 2 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-No further law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
-Cooperate with agent as to home and office visits.
-Cooperate with agent as to any treatment programs deemed appropriate by agent.
-AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens and breathalyzers.
-No driving without a valid drivers license.
-Driver's license revocation for a period of 2 years.
-2 Year IID installed on all vehicles titled/registered to defendant.
-Court imposed a $600. Fine
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and Drunk Driver's  surcharge) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
-Court set restitution at $0.00
-Obtain/maintain employment.
NO CONTACT WITH FIREARMS.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor/ammunition/explosives.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel. 

FILED:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement  mn

Defendant Carlos A Rodriguez in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 2 DISMISSED, Count 3 is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Carlos A Rodriguez in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Carlos A Rodriguez in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.
*5/27/22 INIT ENTRY made for closing purposes.

Defendant Carlos A Rodriguez in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is adjourned for plea and sentencing in br 45.  mn  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
